item.title: Covid 19 coronavirus: What you need to know about today's vaccine announcement
item.description: The Government today announced its first Covid-19 vaccine purchase agreement. What does that mean? Science reporter Jamie Morton explains. What's been announced? A deal that would get New Zealand about 1.5 million Covid-19...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202042/AP201009070102_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=The Government has signed an agreement to purchase 1.5 million Covid-19 vaccines - enough for 750,000 people. Photo / AP

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202042/170920LT11_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=The Covid-19 Vaccine Company led by Dr Robert Feldman aims to complete its first human trial of a new vaccine by the end of next year, which will cost around $8 million. Photo / Supplied

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202042/A49O8095_20200827115938177_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern tours Wellington's Malaghan Institute of Medical Research, which is involved in a local consortium working on locally made vaccines. Photo / Getty Images

item.title: Facial recognition deal opens access to public and private parties
item.description: From RNZ The Government has done a deal over facial recognition technology that throws access to it wide open.The Department of Internal Affairs has signed a master agreement with a leading global biometrics tech supplier that...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202042/GettyImages-1149113608_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=The facial recognition master deal was signed with the New Zealand subsidiary of US giant DXC Technology. Photo / Getty Images

item.title: Covid's tech boom: IBM offering free courses to get diversity into tech industry
item.description: A large number of New Zealand job seekers want to switch careers to technology but are concerned they lack the skills to get into the expanding industry. A new study by tech giant IBM shows two in five New Zealanders would consider...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202041/MikeSmithIBM_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Free and flexible courses encourage diversity in the tech sector by removing barriers of time and cost, says Mike Smith, of IBM. Photo / Supplied

item.title: Facebook to ban groups that support Qanon
item.description: Facebook said it will ban groups that openly support QAnon, the baseless conspiracy theory that paints President Donald Trump as a secret warrior against a supposed child-trafficking ring run by celebrities and "deep state" government...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202041/AP20280757205720_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Facebook is finally taking steps against the dangerous conspiracy theory. Photo / AP

item.title: 5G iPhone expected at Apple's Oct 13 event
item.description: Insiders at Vodafone NZ and Spark both say one event will push 5G into the mainstream more than any other: the release of the first 5G iPhone.Now, it seems that an announcement is just days away. Read More Fitness service,...

item.title: Accenture buys NZ's Zag for $46m in first post-Covid acquisition
item.description: Accenture has bought NZ-based consulting firm Zag in the multi-national's first major deal since the Covid outbreak began.Neither side put a price tag on the deal, but the AFR put it at A$45 million ($46.4m). Read More The...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202041/zag_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Zag chief executive Nick Mulcahy (left) with Accenture New Zealand MD Ben Morgan. Photo / Supplied

item.title: Massey shake-up: Over a third of academic science staff could go
item.description: Massey University scientists are reeling from fresh bombshell proposals they say would spell the biggest cut to science academics in New Zealand's history.Massey science faculty staff were this morning sent a revised discussion...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202041/A_080320SPLAlbanyCampus1_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Massey University scientists are reeling from fresh bombshell proposals they say could spell the biggest cut to science academics in New Zealand's history. item.title: Sky TV hints at big changes to plans, cut-price broadband
item.description: Sky TV plans could be in for a big shake-up, with keener pricing and more pick-and-mix choice - and its pending internet service could be very cheap, if you sign up to enough channels.You could also get the option to bundle apps...
